best.why: B is the only version that actually advances the argument instead of restating Section I. It introduces new conceptual territory — attention as mined resource, verification as unpaid labor, the swap test, the smelting metaphor — while matching the manifesto's staccato declarative rhythm. It earns its length.

worst.why: D is nearly a verbatim copy of Section I — the cost lines, Gutenberg, photography, all of it. Placing it as a later section would make the manifesto stutter. It adds only the smelting line, which B delivers better in context.

must_survive_line: If your work can be swapped with a thousand near-twins and nothing essential changes, it is slop.
